meanings.definition: The state or quality of being eager.
meanings.sent1: Her eagernesses to learn new things made her a top student in class.
meanings.sent2: The children's eagernesses to open their presents on Christmas morning was contagious.
meanings.sent3: His eagernesses to eat all the cookies in one sitting led to a stomachache.
meanings.sent4: The puppy's eagernesses to play fetch showed how much energy he had.
meanings.sent5: The team's eagernesses to win the championship fueled their intense training sessions.

meanings.definition: A strong desire or enthusiasm for something.
meanings.sent1: The artist's eagernesses to create beautiful paintings was evident in every brushstroke.
meanings.sent2: His eagernesses to travel the world led him to explore new cultures and traditions.
meanings.sent3: The child's eagernesses to eat ice cream for dinner was met with a firm 'no' from his parents.
meanings.sent4: Her eagernesses to help others shone through in her volunteer work at the local shelter.
meanings.sent5: The student's eagernesses to excel in sports pushed him to practice every day after school.
